verses.name: Romans 9:19
verses.text: Thou wilt say then unto me, Why doth he yet find fault? For who hath resisted his will?

verses.name: Romans 9:20
verses.text: Nay but, O man, who art thou that repliest against God? Shall the thing formed say to him that formed it, Why hast thou made me thus?

verses.name: Romans 9:21
verses.text: Hath not the potter power over the clay, of the same lump to make one vessel unto honour, and another unto dishonour?

verses.name: Romans 9:22
verses.text: What if God, willing to shew his wrath, and to make his power known, endured with much longsuffering the vessels of wrath fitted to destruction:
